title: Guy Delaunay
text:
Guy Delaunay (born 20 September 1960) is a French <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> player who represented <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France national rugby league team</a>.
Playing career.
Starting his career for <a href="XIII%20Catalan">XIII Catalan</a>, Delaunay marked the 1980s with said club winning several <a href="French%20Rugby%20League%20Championship">French Championship</a> titles in 1982. 1983, 1984 and 1985 and a <a href="Lord%20Derby%20Cup">Lord Derby Cup</a> in 1980. He later joined the other club of <a href="Perpignan">Perpignan</a>, <a href="AS%20Saint%20Esteve">AS Saint Esteve</a>, with which he won a new French Championship title in 1989.
Delaunay made his debut for <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France</a> in 1980 against a <a href="1980%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20league%20tour%20of%20Great%20Britain%20and%20France">touring New Zealand side</a>. He went on to play in 17 test matches for France, including against touring <a href="Australian%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian</a> sides in <a href="1982%20Kangaroo%20tour%20of%20Great%20Britain%20and%20France">1982</a> and <a href="1990%20Kangaroo%20tour%20of%20Great%20Britain%20and%20France">1990</a>, and in matches that were part of the <a href="1985%E2%80%931988%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1985–1988 Rugby League World Cup</a> and <a href="1989%E2%80%931992%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1989–1992 Rugby League World Cup</a>s.
Later years.
Delaunay later worked for <a href="Union%20Treiziste%20Catalane">Union Treiziste Catalane</a> and the <a href="Pia%20Donkeys">Pia Donkeys</a>.
